channel.title: Semiconductors on FinanClub
channel.description: Recent content in Semiconductors on FinanClub

item.title: WDC
item.description: score:195 Chances: Morgan Stanley named Western Digital a ‘Top Pick’, replacing Nvidia, with a price target of $73 representing a potential 30% upside Analysts upgraded WDC’s rating from Hold to Buy, with price targets indicating a potential 25% upside from current levels Semiconductor analyst sees Western Digital offering the best risk-reward opportunity Risks: Potential vulnerability to stock price due to large stake held by institutions Macro economic headwinds and spending cutbacks may affect prospects Score:195 chances characters count - risks characters count = 195

item.title: AVGO
item.description: score:-28 Chances: Broadcom, Inc. shares are surging, ripping 9% year to date. The semiconductor powerhouse enjoyed a solid rally in 2023. Goldman Sachs analyst anticipates robust growth in Broadcom’s AI-related businesses, especially in high-speed networking and custom compute segments. TSMC projected 2024 revenue growth of more than 20% on booming demand for high-end chips used in artificial-intelligence applications.

item.title: ON
item.description: score:71 Chances: ON Semiconductor Corp. (ON) is expected to capture more than 25% of the silicon carbide market by the end of 2023. The stock market is likely to be volatile in 2024, and diligent investors will find opportunities. These stocks have growth potential in 2024 and over the next decade because of megatrend tailwinds.

item.title: AMD
item.description: score:-15 Chances: The White House’s announcement of the first grant for semiconductor manufacturing in the U.S. is a positive catalyst for chip stocks. Analysts believe that Nvidia Corporation controls roughly 80% of the AI chip market, but its rivals, including Advanced Micro Devices Inc, are making significant efforts to catch up.
